feature.name: Sacred Oath: Oath of Chivalry (HB)
feature.text:
Paladins who swear the oath of chivalry are stalwart defenders of the innocent and weak, standing between them and those who would do them harm through dark magic and deceit. Chivalric paladins are known to venture into darkness in order to light the way for others, and to seek out those who spread the darkness and vanquish them
Tenets of Chivalry: The Oath of Chivalry has appeared throughout history in many forms, its exact wording shifting from era to era, but in essence paladins of this oath share these tenets.
Truth. Above all, be true to your word and oppose deceit and trickery.
Selflessness. Champion the weak, and serve them before your own needs.
Justice. Seek out and punish those who break their oaths or harm the innocent.
Integrity. Set yourself as an example to others, acting with honor and forthrightness.
Oath Spells: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels in the Oath of Chivalry Spells table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.
Oath of Chivalry Spells: Level | Spells 3rd | compelled duel, healing word 5th | see invisibility, zone of truth 9th | counterspell, remove curse 13th | death ward, guardian of faith 17th | dispel evil and good, greater restoration
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 20 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Divine Charm (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
As a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to enhance your social graces and intuition. For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Shining Beacon (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to begin shining with the light of truth for as long as you concentrate (as though concentrating on a spell) for up to 1 minute. For this duration, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius, and dim light 10 feet beyond that. When a creature that starts its turn within this light, or enters it for the first time during a turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by it. Affected creatures are outlined in shining light, revealing their true forms if they are magically disguised, and gain no benefit from being invisible. Additionally, affected creatures cannot speak lies, though they are under no compulsion to reveal truths they wish to remain secret. When your concentration ends, affected creatures are no longer affected.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Silver Smite (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
When you use your Divine Smite feature, your weapon is considered silvered for the attack and you deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage if the target of the attack is a fey creature.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Aura of Grace (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
You emanate an aura that protects the souls of you and those around you, safeguarding against the fell magic of witches, dark fey, and other malicious beings. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be cursed while you are conscious. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Soul of Justice (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
You are vigilant against the magical trickery of your foes. When a creature you can see forces you or another target to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against magic, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature if it is within range. If your attack hits, the saving throw is made with advantage.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Champion of Truth (Oath of Chivalry (HB))
feature.text:
As a bonus action, you mantle yourself in the righteous power of truth itself, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute.
• You gain truesight out to a radius of 120 feet.
• All of your attacks made against fiends, undead, fey, or any creature who has disguised their true form are made with advantage.
• You are immune to enchantment spells and can't be charmed.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 21 (Homebrew)
